summary: This is an email chain from September 2020 among legal personnel discussing the inability to locate the first volume of a 2009 deposition transcript from a civil case against Jeffrey Epstein. The emails reference detailed notes taken by a paralegal/investigator who attended the deposition, which describe the victim profile and Epstein's pattern of behavior.

persons.name: Jack Scarola
persons.context: Attorney involved in the correspondence, seeking confirmation about a protective order and the location of a deposition transcript from a 2009 civil case against Epstein.

persons.name: Mike Danchuk
persons.context: Paralegal/Investigator who attended the 2009 deposition against Epstein and recorded contemporaneous notes, which are referenced as painting a picture of the victims.

persons.name: Chris R. Rodgers
persons.context: Forwarded an email confirming the inability to locate the deposition transcript and attached Mike Danchuk's notes.

persons.name: Mary McCann
persons.context: Cc'd on an email in the chain discussing the deposition transcript.

persons.name: Wendy P. Calvet
persons.context: Cc'd on an email in the chain discussing the deposition transcript.

persons.name: Toni
persons.context: Employee of Prose Court Reporting who responded that they were unable to locate Volume I of the 2009 deposition transcript.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the 2009 civil suit and deposition; described as having a pattern of recruitment, grooming, and victimization of troubled young women.

connections.description: Colleagues communicating about legal case logistics, specifically the search for a deposition transcript.
Danchuk attended and took notes on Epstein's deposition, documenting his pattern of behavior and victim profile.
Rodgers contacted Toni at Prose Court Reporting to locate the deposition transcript; Toni responded that it could not be found.

events.title: Deposition in Civil Case vs. Epstein
events.description: A deposition was taken in a civil case against Jeffrey Epstein. The first volume of the transcript is missing, but contemporaneous notes by Mike Danchuk exist.

events.title: Court Reporter Unable to Locate Transcript
events.description: Toni from Prose Court Reporting confirms a search of records and archives failed to locate Volume I of the 2009 deposition transcript.

events.title: Email Chain Regarding Protective Order
events.description: Jack Scarola states he is unaware of any protective order governing the disclosure of materials from the civil case, following up on earlier inquiries about the deposition transcript.

keyFacts: The first volume of a December 4, 2009 deposition transcript from a civil case against Jeffrey Epstein could not be located by the court reporting service in 2020.

Contemporaneous notes from the deposition, taken by paralegal/investigator Mike Danchuk, were available and described Epstein's pattern of recruiting, grooming, and victimizing 'troubled young women'.
An attorney involved sought to confirm whether a protective order existed that would restrict sharing materials from the civil case, indicating he was unaware of any such order.
The email chain originates from the law firm Searcy Denney Scarola Barnhart & Shipley, P.A., and is marked as privileged and confidential.
